metadata.title: CVE-2023-52794 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:thermal: intel: powerclamp: fix mismatch in get function for max_idleKASAN reported this      [ 444.853098] BUG: KASAN: global-out-of-bounds inparam_get_int+0x77/0x90      [ 444.853111] Read of size 4 at addr ffffffffc16c9220 by taskcat/2105      ...      [ 444.853442] The buggy address belongs to the variable:      [ 444.853443] max_idle+0x0/0xffffffffffffcde0 [intel_powerclamp]There is a mismatch between the param_get_int and the definition ofmax_idle.  Replacing param_get_int with param_get_byte resolves thisissue.

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-kvm package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
